intro: Uragoga castellana, commonly known as the Castilian uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
